Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.clientSide.viewers.interfaces

Class Viewer

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
it.polimi.ingsw.view.clientSide.viewers.interfaces.Viewer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CLIViewer, GUIViewer, TerminalViewer, WTerminalViewer
public abstract class Viewer
extends java.lang.Thread
Class managing the connection between the common back-end of the View (/Client) and the Viewers (front end). This class can (/have to) be extended with a specific one for each new Viewer, but has some static methods and functionalities that will make easier the communication to all the Viewers.
Author:
giorgio

  • Nested Class Summary

    Modifier and Type Class Description

    • exit

      public void exit()
      Method called before quitting the program.

    • enqueue

      protected void enqueue​(Viewer.ViewerQueuedEvent event)
      Method that adds a ViewerQueuedEvent to the blockingQueue. It'll add all the ViewerQueuedEvent that cannot be executed immediately and so will be retrieved by a different thread. Should be overrided in each new Viewer.
      Parameters:
      event - (the ViewerQueuedEvent to add to the BlockingQueue).

    • wakersNotify

      protected void wakersNotify()
      Method that will notify all the threads waiting on the wakers Object.

    • goOn

      public void goOn() throws CheckQueueException
      Method to check if the BlockingQueue is empty or not. It'll not throw rhe Queue is empty, else it'll throw the CheckQueueException.
      Throws:
      CheckQueueException - (iif the BlockingQueue isn't empty).

    • waitTimeOut

      public void waitTimeOut​(long timeOut) throws CheckQueueException
      Method to be called to wait for the timeout or throw CheckQueueException if/when BlockingQueue is no longer empty.
      Parameters:
      timeOut - (the timeOut duration in millis).
      Throws:
      CheckQueueException - (iif the BlockingQueue is no empty).

    • getNextEvent

      protected Viewer.ViewerQueuedEvent getNextEvent() throws EmptyQueueException
      Method returning the first event added into the Blocking queue and removes it from the queue (FIFO).
      Returns:
      (the first ViewerQueuedEvent of the BlockingQueue).
      Throws:
      EmptyQueueException - (if the BlockingQueue is empty).

    • seeEnqueuedType

      public Viewer.ViewerQueuedEvent.ViewerQueuedEventType seeEnqueuedType() throws EmptyQueueException
      Method returning the type of the first element of the BlockingQueue without removing it
      Returns:
      (the type of the first event enqueued into the BlockingQueue).
      Throws:
      EmptyQueueException - (iif the BlockingQueue is empty).

    • waitNextEventType

      @Deprecated public void waitNextEventType​(Viewer.ViewerQueuedEvent.ViewerQueuedEventType eventType)
      Deprecated.
      Method that waits until a new event of specified type is added to the BlockingQueue It'll create some problems and so it's not recomended to use it unless a really strong belif it's the only way.
      Parameters:
      eventType - (type of the event it's waiting for).

    • isEnqueuedType

      public boolean isEnqueuedType​(Viewer.ViewerQueuedEvent.ViewerQueuedEventType eventType)
      Method searcching if there is an event of given type inside the queue.
      Parameters:
      eventType - (the type of the event searched).
      Returns:
      (true iif there is at least one event in the queue with such a type).

    • waitNextEvent

      public void waitNextEvent()
      Method that will wait untill there is a new event on the BlockingQueue.
